themes: insufficient grant opportunities for nontraditional projects
lack of financial support for writers and audio drama creators
inability to fairly compensate local artists and production staff
burden of self-marketing and administrative work
stress due to financial instability and high cost of living
limited paid work opportunities for creative professionals
key_phrases: There aren’t enough grants for projects that lie outside of the usual categories
there is not enough support for writers
we don’t have the money to pay our actors or our production people very much
Crowd funding is also time consuming—and doesn’t begin to cover all of our expenses
I have to market the whole thing myself
All of this is incredibly difficult and stressful
constantly looking for/doing gig or temp work to pay the bills
The higher the cost of living, the more stressful it gets
there isn’t enough work for people to pay the bills
barriers_identified: insufficient grant opportunities for unconventional projects
inability to adequately pay actors and production staff
financial stress due to reliance on gig or temp work
scarcity of paid work for creative professionals
